Package oshi.util

Class MapUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • oshi.util.MapUtil
  • public class MapUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Allow Java 8 features on Java 7 HashMaps
    Author:
    widdis[at]gmail[dot]com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static <K,​V>
      java.util.List<V>      		 createNewListIfAbsent​(java.util.Map<K,​java.util.List<V>> map, K key)
      If the specified key is not already associated with a value (or is mapped to null) associates it with a new List and returns it, else returns the current value.

      Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or defaultValue if this map contains no mapping for the key.
      static <K,​V>
      V      		 putIfAbsent​(java.util.Map<K,​V> map, K key, V value)
      If the specified key is not already associated with a value (or is mapped to null) associates it with the given value and returns null, else returns the current value.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrDefault

        public static <K,​V> V getOrDefault​(java.util.Map<K,​V> map,
                                         K key,
                                         V defaultValue)
        Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or defaultValue if this map contains no mapping for the key.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The map key type
        V - The map value type
        Parameters:
        map - the map to use
        key - the key whose associated value is to be returned
        defaultValue - the default mapping of the key
        Returns:
        the value to which the specified key is mapped, or defaultValue if this map contains no mapping for the key

      • putIfAbsent

        public static <K,​V> V putIfAbsent​(java.util.Map<K,​V> map,
                                        K key,
                                        V value)
        If the specified key is not already associated with a value (or is mapped to null) associates it with the given value and returns null, else returns the current value.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The map key type
        V - The map value type
        Parameters:
        map - the map to use
        key - key with which the specified value is to be associated
        value - value to be associated with the specified key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified key, or null if there was no mapping for the key. (A null return can also indicate that the map previously associated null with the key, if the implementation supports null values.)

      • createNewListIfAbsent

        public static <K,​V> java.util.List<V> createNewListIfAbsent​(java.util.Map<K,​java.util.List<V>> map,
                                                                  K key)
        If the specified key is not already associated with a value (or is mapped to null) associates it with a new List and returns it, else returns the current value.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The map key type
        V - The map value type in the list
        Parameters:
        map - the map to use
        key - key with which the specified value is to be associated
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified key, or a new list
